column4: When I try to change the theme on my desktop, it isn't applied properly. I've tried reinstalling my theme and icon packages, but that didn't help. What more can I do?
is the correct engine for the theme installed?
I assume so - *none* of the themes apply themselves correctly. I'm stuck on the fugly fallback theme you get when you do `gksudo gedit` etc
here is a list: apt-cache search gtk2-engines
the default theme uses an engine in the following package : gtk2-engines
I just reinstalled it - no change :\
are you using gnome?
yes
try logging in with another user. if this works there is something wrong in your configfiles
will do
AHA!! It does work on a guest user! :D
i can't tell you how to fix it without getting rid of your config alltogether
If you can point me to where this configuration is stored, I'll try poking around in there a bit.
don't know. somewhere in .gconf/   or   .config/
ok, I'll have a peek
thanks, trying another user account was smart, i should have thought of that
.gconf/apps/metacity/   i think this is it.
seems like it's not the only thing though .gconf/desktop/gnome/interface/
Yeah, a search for 'theme' shows lots of results...
should just be the 2 directories i gave you.
seems like it's not the only thing though .gconf/desktop/gnome/interface/
.gconf/apps/metacity/   i think this is it.
What was the drastic action you were going to suggest to blow away my settings in gconf to hopefully un-stick my theme? Just delete ~/.gconf?
that would work as well. do make a backup though.
